abstract: The $35.5 billion sale of the American International Group’s Asian life insurance unit to Prudential P.L.C. will make one set of firms happy: the bankers and lawyers who helped craft the massive transaction.
snippet: The $35.5 billion sale of the American International Group’s Asian life insurance unit to Prudential P.L.C. will make one set of firms happy: the bankers and lawyers who helped craft the massive transaction.
lead_paragraph: Few people are happier when a deal is struck than the advisers who helped make it happen. And in the case of the sale of the American International Group‘s Asian life insurance unit to Prudential P.L.C. — the largest deal so far this year — there are more than a few firms to grab fees.

headline.main: Banking on Big Fees From the A.I.G. Deal

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Federal Reserve Bank of New York
